column4: how do i get the driver "xserver-xorg-video-intel" from the package manager to show up in System>Administration>Hardware Drivers? go easy, i'm very new
you can't get visual effects when you do not have a working driver, your gonna have to remove your driver then install it
do i do that in the synaptic package manager?
you can do it through command line. what graphics driver version have you got and waht graphics card?
i'm not sure what driver i have, (still a noob) but my card is a X3100 also called i965 i believe, its a macbook 4,1
is your's a nvidia card, ati or intel integrated graphics?
oh, sorry luke_ i'm not familiar with those ones
i'll see if i can find it in the repos
at least then I'll know what to remove
when searching your model number in the repos i found one package that apperaed to be a driver. it was xserver-xorg-video-intel
is see that in my package manager brayden, should i uninstall then re install it, or is there more to it?

to remove all the dependancies from a package you type into terminal e.g. sudo apt-get autoremove xserver-xorg-video-intel then you can just reinstall it with the apt-get install command. this of course requires reboot
thanks alot! i'll try that right now
